Package giba.controller

Class DashboardController

  • java.lang.Object
    • giba.controller.DashboardController
  • public class DashboardController
extends java.lang.Object
    The DashboardController handles all activities on the dashboard including: completing tasks, adding tasks, removing tasks, refreshing the tasks, viewing selected task details, and viewing the history of completed tasks.
    Author:
    Andrew Cavallaro

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      DashboardController()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addTaskPressed​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      The addTaskPressed method brings the user to the add task page to allow them to enter a new task into the program.
      void clearSelection()
      The clearSelection method clears the upcomingTable and completedTable view selections when clicking on the todayTable.
      void clearSelectionThree()
      The clearSelection method clears the todayTable and upcomingTable view selections when clicking on the completedTable.
      void clearSelectionTwo()
      The clearSelectionTwo method clears the todayTable and completedTable view selections when clicking on the upcomingTable.
      void completeTask​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      The completeTask method brings the user to completeTask page where the user can confirm completion of a selected task from the dashboard.
      void initialize()
      The initialize method is responsible for populating the table views with data from the database with tasks.
      void refresh()
      The refresh method calls the initialize method which re-initializes the dashboard to the latest information from the database.
      void removeTask()
      The removeTask method is responsible for removing a task from the database so that it no longer populates on the dashboard.
      void signOutPressed​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      The signOutPressed method signs the user out of the system and returns them to login page.
      void viewHistory​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      The viewHistory method shows the history of completed tasks by reading from a saved file that gets appended to each time a task is marked as complete.
      void viewTaskDetails​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      The viewTaskDetails method will display to the user the details of the selected task.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • addTaskPressed

        public void addTaskPressed​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        The addTaskPressed method brings the user to the add task page to allow them to enter a new task into the program.
        Parameters:
        event - Mouse clicked on "+"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - yes, it does

      • removeTask

        public void removeTask()
                throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                       java.sql.SQLException
        The removeTask method is responsible for removing a task from the database so that it no longer populates on the dashboard. It requires approval before being removed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - yes, it does
        java.sql.SQLException - yes, it does

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
             throws java.sql.SQLException,
                    java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        The refresh method calls the initialize method which re-initializes the dashboard to the latest information from the database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - yes, it does
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - yes, it does

        The signOutPressed method signs the user out of the system and returns them to login page.
        Parameters:
        event - Mouse clicked on "Sign Out"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - yes, it does

      • completeTask

        public void completeTask​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        The completeTask method brings the user to completeTask page where the user can confirm completion of a selected task from the dashboard.
        Parameters:
        event - Mouse click on "Complete Task"

        java.io.IOException - yes, it does

      • viewTaskDetails

        public void viewTaskDetails​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        The viewTaskDetails method will display to the user the details of the selected task.
        Parameters:
        event - Mouse click on button "View Details"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • viewHistory

        public void viewHistory​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        The viewHistory method shows the history of completed tasks by reading from a saved file that gets appended to each time a task is marked as complete.
        Parameters:
        event - Mouse click on "View History"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - yes, it does
